alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 11:39AM EDT until July 29 at 11:22PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 30.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Friday was 34.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 5.7 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.0 feet on 03/19/2002. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 5 PM EDT.
